paper_abstract: For a polynomial ring R = k[x(1)..., x(n)], we present a method to compute the characteristic cycle of the localization R-f for any nonzero polynomial f is an element of R that avoids a direct computation of R-f as a D-module. Based on this approach, we develop an algorithm for computing the characteristic cycle of the local cohomology modules H-l(r)(R) for any ideal I subset of R using the Cech complex. The algorithm, in particular, is useful for answering questions regarding vanishing of local cohomology modules and computing Lyubeznik numbers. These applications are illustrated by examples of computations using our implementation of the algorithm in Macaulay 2. (c) 2006 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Computing the support of local cohomology modules
